channel.title: The Aurelia Blog
channel.description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

item.title: AureliaCasts - Creating Compelling Aurelia Video Tutorials
item.description: This week, we're proud to have community member and creator of AureliaCasts, Nick Shallee, guest posting to share with our community what he's been up to.

item.title: Aurelia Users Community Space Guides
item.description: Today, I'd like to invite a long-time Aurelia Community Member, Nikolaj Ivancic, to share a little bit about the "AUCS" community project that he's leading to help improve Aurelia's documentation. Take it away Nik!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early February 2018
item.description: Continuing into 2018, we've got a number of fixes and improvements to core Aurelia libraries and plugins. The details are available below.

item.title: Big Changes in the Aurelia Router 1.5.0 Release
item.description: Thanks to the new features in the latest update to the Aurelia router, building a beautiful and functional master-detail page in Aurelia is quick and easy.

item.title: Aurelia 2018 Roadmap
item.description: 2017 was a great year for Aurelia but 2018 is shaping up to be even better!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - December 2017
item.description: 2017 is almost at an end. So, we wanted to close out this year with another set of releases to Aurelia, its plugins and tools. Below you can read the details on the bug fixes, performance improvements and new features available in the latest libraries.

item.title: Aurelia OpenID Connect
item.description: This week we invite Aurelia community member, Shaun Luttin [https://github.com/shaunluttin], to share with us a bit about the Aurelia OpenID connect plugin he's been working on. Take it away Shaun...

item.title: Aurelia Framework7
item.description: Thanks to the investigative work of one of our community members, Andy [https://github.com/weoreference], we've got another great Aurelia component framework to share with you: Aurelia-Framework7. Read on to learn more, directly from Alexander Flenniken [https://github.com/alflennik], the creator of this project...

item.title: Aurelia UX Overhaul
item.description: We've been doing some major work on Aurelia UX, both in terms of building out components and refining the core capabilities and approach. In this post, we'd like to share a bit about the details of our most recent set of releases.

item.title: Projects That Make Aurelia Shine
item.description: This week, Aurelia community member and author, Sean Hunter, shares a section from his book "Aurelia in Action".

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early November 2017
item.description: As always, the Aurelia Team continues to fix bugs, add new features and make tons of improvements throughout the framework. In this set of releases, we've got a minor breaking change to our dialog plugin. We've also converted our testing library to TypeScript. While we've made no changes to the API or behavior, we've bumped the major version since the improved, more-accurate typings may affect some TypeScript users. Finally, we've launched another major set of enhancements to the CLI and made our initial launch of the HTTP Mocking library. Huge thanks to Thomas Schlage [https://github.com/fragsalat] for his work on the new library.

item.title: Announcing the Aurelia Discourse and New Site Experience!
item.description: Today, we're thrilled to announce that we've launched the official Aurelia Discourse forum [https://discourse.aurelia.io]! At the same time, we've completely overhauled our site [http://aurelia.io/] and documentation technology, opening the way for better docs and learning to come.

item.title: Aurelia at Techdays The Netherlands
item.description: Techdays The Netherlands is just two days away! There's some great Aurelia content for you, if you are attending this event. Read on to learn more about the upcoming talks.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early October 2017
item.description: We've just made a massive set of releases to Aurelia's core libraries and plugins. This set of releases includes perf optimizations, reduced memory utilization, removal of a memory leak, plenty of fixed bugs and adds some new features!

item.title: Case Study: Ivee 3D Editor - Aurelia+Azure+ASP.NET+Redux+ThreeJS
item.description: Today, I'm pleased to introduce you to Daniel Radu. Dan is a member of our Aurelia community who has been building some pretty awesome stuff by combining Aurelia [http://aurelia.io] with Microsoft Azure [https://azure.microsoft.com]. I'll let Dan tell you about his experiences, in his own words...

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Late August 2017
item.description: We've got a number of bug fixes, enhancements and perf improvements this time around. In particular, we've made some substantial fixes to our CLI Webpack support.

item.title: Aurelia CLI Webpack Update!
item.description: Today, I'm thrilled to announce that we've added support for Webpack 3 to the Aurelia CLI. With this addition, the CLI supports project generation equally for Webpack, SystemJS and RequireJS.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Mid August 2017
item.description: Today, we have a small set of release to update you with. We're gearing up for some big releases next. Stay tuned for more...

item.title: Introducing Aurelia in Action
item.description: Aurelia in Action [https://www.manning.com/books/aurelia-in-action] is a book targeted at teaching you what you need to build compelling, real-world applications in Aurelia from the ground up. The book centres around a fictional virtual bookshelf application (similar to Goodreads.com [https://www.goodreads.com/]) called my-books. We start off by creating a bare-bones application via the Aurelia CLI, then progressively layer on various features that users would want in a virtual bookshelf. By the end of the book we've built out a fully fledged SPA, giving you the chance to familiarise yourself with the many tools available in Aurelia's tool-belt along the way. Save 45% off Aurelia in Action [https://www.manning.com/books/aurelia-in-action] with discount code aureliash at Manning.com [https://www.manning.com/] today!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early July 2017
item.description: The Aurelia Team continues to iterate and improve all aspects of the framework. Below you can find details on our recent minor release of aurelia-validation along with our patch releases of the aurelia-cli and aurelia-polyfills.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Mid June 2017
item.description: This year, Aurelia's theme has been one of building out our ecosystem by enhancing plugins, tools, learning and community opportunity. Our releases today reflect that focus by showcasing improvements to several plugins (UX, Dialog and i18n) and launching a big update to our CLI.

item.title: Introducing Aurelia Succinctly
item.description: Interested in checking out a free book on Aurelia? Check out Aurelia Succinctly! It gives a great foundation for building your Aurelia applications.

item.title: Aurelia at Build 2017
item.description: If you are attending Build [http://build.microsoft.com] and are interested in seeing how to combine ASP.NET Core [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/] and Aurelia [http://aurelia.io], you'll want to attend "Getting Started with Aurelia and ASP.NET Core" this Friday.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Late April 2017
item.description: Our most recent set of Aurelia releases includes the Aurelia Dialog Release Candidate. We have a post dedicated to the details of that release, which you can read here [http://blog.aurelia.io/2017/04/27/aurelia-dialog-release-candidate/]. You'll also see that Aurelia UX is moving ahead steadily, with new components and capabilities being added every one to two weeks.

item.title: Aurelia Dialog Release Candidate
item.description: Thanks to the hard work of Aurelia Core Team members, Strahil Kazlachev and Patrick Walters, we're proud to announce the Aurelia Dialog v1 Release Candidate.
